page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: There are no public transport services available in this area. Buses serve nearby villages. The nearest railway stations are Cheltenham, Evesham and Morton in the Marsh, which are 10 or more miles away. People who live here must therefore depend on their own transport, and need cars or motor bikes. Farmers also make occasional use of the roads to move heavy farm machinery or for instance to take sheep to market outside the area for instance at Andoversford or Gloucester. The roads are all minor roads linking villages outside the area such as the Guitings and Winchcombe. The road from Winchcombe to Hawling is known as the Salt Way and follows the line of a historic tract. A narrow road unsuitable for motors. It goes through Guiting Wood.
